"Do you tell me that the Bible is against our rights? Then I say that our claims do not rest upon a book written no one knows when, or by whom. Do you tell me what Paul or Peter says on the subject? Then again I reply that our claims do not rest on the opinions of any one, not even on those of Paul and Peter, . . . Books and opinions, no matter from whom they came, if they are in opposition to human rights, are nothing but dead letters."
 
 -- Ernestine Rose, responding to religious heckler at Seventh National Woman's Rights Convention, New York, Nov. 25-26, 1856 (History of Woman Suffrage, Vol. 1: 661-663)

 Devorce is wrong. Unless she comits adultry and is to be stoned t0 death, and by the word of god, STONE HER! You may nto devorce her unless this be!
 
 THink of all the stuff in the bible. THink hard about it, and tell me that a god of love, a god of mercy put these words to scripture.
 
 SO don't dare state Gay Marirage is wrong, nor gay addopton, unless you start livign by the above examples. Otherwise you are not a christian followign the word of god. Or is it the decided word of god by the hand of man?

"Do you tell me that the Bible is against our rights? Then I say that our claims do not rest upon a book written no one knows when, or by whom. Do you tell me what Paul or Peter says on the subject? Then again I reply that our claims do not rest on the opinions of any one, not even on those of Paul and Peter, . . . Books and opinions, no matter from whom they came, if they are in opposition to human rights, are nothing but dead letters."
 
 -- Ernestine Rose, responding to religious heckler at Seventh National Woman's Rights Convention, New York, Nov. 25-26, 1856 (History of Woman Suffrage, Vol. 1: 661-663)

Spelling and grammer isn't the topic, nor a needed reply. Easily said, but not helping a topic.
 
 Spell check isn't an option when posting from my mobile device, nor needed. The point is made, and that should be where the focus is made. Since in no way has it helped the debate.

 
 It appears you and I disagree on the importance of spelling. I strongly feel that proper spelling and grammar improves communication and hence the quality of the debate. The content may be brilliant, but it can be lost if communicated poorly.

Doesn't this assume a standard for what rights actually exist? If so, then what is the standard? Where did they come from?
